listings.title: Gibson Heritage Reissue Flying V 1982 - Natural

listings.description:
1982 Gibson Heritage Series Flying V

This is a factory-original 1982 Gibson Heritage Series Flying V, part of a limited reissue run from Gibson‚Äôs early 1980s Nashville production. It retains all original hardware, finish, electronics, and pickups ‚Äî with no signs of structural repair or modification.

üîç Key Details:

Serial Number: C154 (stamped on the back of the headstock)
Finish: Antique Natural (marked ‚ÄúAnt. Nat.‚Äù in body cavity)
Case: Original Gibson ‚Äúchainsaw‚Äù case (with minor cosmetic repair)

‚úÖ Structural Integrity

  • Original set-neck construction with a long tenon is visible through the neck pickup cavity.
  • No signs of a neck reset, break, or structural damage. The internal wood is clean, with original tool marks and factory glue visible.
  • Internal markings include red/black factory stamps, typical of early 1980s Nashville builds.

üîå Electronics

  • All CTS pots are original and date-coded:
    • 1378030 = 30th week of 1980
    • 1378145 = 45th week of 1981
  • Original ceramic disc tone caps (HP 223Z 100V)
  • Untouched solder joints and original cloth/PVC/braided wiring
  • Fully functional Switchcraft-style toggle with correct felt dampers

üé∏ Pickups

  • Original Tim Shaw-era humbuckers, stamped 1531182 and 1541182
  • These are Gibson's most collectible early 1980s humbuckers, known for their articulate midrange and vintage voicing
  • Correct double-row pole screws and braided leads

üß≥ Case

  • The original Gibson chainsaw case is included and functional
  • One area on the lid has been professionally repaired; the case is still secure and latches close as they should

üìå Finish Checking (Common, Age-Related)

This guitar shows light lacquer checking around the neck joint ‚Äî common in vintage Gibsons with nitro finishes. These checks are:

  • Purely cosmetic
  • Due to natural aging and wood expansion/contraction
  • Not structural (confirmed by inspection of the tenon and body cavity)

This is expected and acceptable on a well-preserved instrument of this vintage and does not affect tone or playability.

This Flying V is a well-preserved, fully original example of an early '80s Gibson reissue with no alterations. Structurally solid, electronically untouched, and collector-grade correct ‚Äî this is a textbook specimen of a Heritage Series Flying V with rare Tim Shaw pickups.
listings.title: Gibson Flying V Heritage Korina Reissue 1982

listings.description:
We are a used music store in Hiroshima.

-------------------------------------------------------------------

A very rare Gibson Flying V Heritage Korina Reissue produced around 1981 to 1983, featuring an early specification with an A serial number.


It boasts a 3-piece korina body, a 3-piece korina neck with 21-fret joint, inheriting the specifications of the 1970s, and a rosewood fingerboard with precious korina wood.


With features like the headstock logo, ABR-1 bridge, V-shaped plate, and rubber on the body side, it closely resembles the original specs and exudes a great atmosphere.


*The tuners have been replaced.


Frets: 60% with some wear

Neck: Almost straight

Weight: 2.71 kg

Overall, it has started to develop weather checking.


*Comes with original hard case.




If you have any questions or concerns, which might be difficult to point out from pictures, please feel free to contact us.


*All accessories are showed in the pictures.

*Operation check has been done.


We would try to update the information as soon as possible.

However, all the items are on sale at the store and the online same time, please forgive us if the item is already sold out.

listings.title: Gibson Flying V2 II 1979-1982 - Natural

listings.description:
Gibson Flying V2

1980 Made in the USA

With original Gibson Hard Case

What I can say ?! ‚úåÔ∏èüôÇüëç

If you love musical instruments and in particular electric guitars, this is a unique guitar with components that you will only find here, with a quality worthy of the Custom Shop.

Purchased in what is probably the most famous Gibson retailer in Italy, the receipt of the aforementioned purchase is attached, from which the legitimate origin.

The guitar is 100% original, works perfectly in all its parts, has normal signs of use, and the Gibson tune-o-matic bridge was replaced with a new identical Gibson one 2 days ago, its original tune-o-matic is also attached which can be reused simply by putting the saddles of the identical new one (but I don't think it is of any use) it is perfect and original even so. SEE PHOTOS

The guitar has been played and never mistreated, some ding dong, the previous owner had "written his secret code" on the headstock and inside the potentiometer compartment, perhaps because he was afraid of being robbed? (SEE PHOTOS WHERE HIGHLIGHTED)

The original Gibson tuners work perfectly and are marked by time. If desired, they can be replaced for 200 or 250 euros, but this too is useless for the purposes of use.

The guitar has been completely checked: tuners disassembled and lubricated, fretboard cleaned with lemon oil and frets polished, potentiometers cleaned with specific products... Fitted a set of new D'addario Nickel Wound 0.9, 42 strings.

The case is also obviously marked by time, but it is solid and has no smell, other than its typical smell of Gibson Hard-Case! These cases are also sold in much worse conditions around 1000 euros because they are identical to those used by Gibson Flying until the end of the 70s.

The price is the lowest you can find especially with the original case, these cases are sometimes sold at very high prices because they are the same ones that were used on models that are really expensive today.
listings.title: Gibson Flying V2 II 1979-1982 - Natural with ORIGINAL HARD CASE

- Overall: Very Good condition.

- Electronics: All original, no issues.
- Finish: This Guitar is in Very Good condition with minimal wear through previous usage. Some slight markings in the lacquer through
Hard Case included.

* Please note all of our USED Guitars are checked, tested and cleaned by our Luthiers before dispatching. All USED Guitars come with 3-month warranty. For more information, please drop us a message and we will be happy to help!

The Gibson Flying V2 II, produced between 1979 and 1982, is a distinctive electric guitar that stands out due to its unique design and construction. The body comprises a five-layer sandwich of maple and walnut, sculpted to create a three-dimensional effect, and is finished in a natural wood tone to highlight the layered woods. This model features a set neck with a rosewood fretboard and 22 frets, providing a comfortable playing experience.

Equipped with Gibson's "boomerang" humbucking pickups, the Flying V2 II delivers a sound that blends the clarity of single-coil pickups with the warmth of humbuckers. The guitar also includes a brass nut and a "V" shaped tailpiece, contributing to its unique aesthetic and tonal characteristics. The hardware is finished in gold, complementing the natural wood finish of the body.

The Flying V2 II was part of Gibson's effort to innovate and redefine the Flying V design. Despite its bold design and features, the model did not achieve significant commercial success and was discontinued in 1982. Today, it remains a collector's item, appreciated for its distinctive look and the innovation it represented in Gibson's guitar design history.
listings.sku: 30.9.25 Gibson Flying V2 II in Natural, (Used)
listings.title: Gibson Flying V2 II Electric Guitar in Natural + Hard Case (Used)

listings.description:
Gibson 1980 V2 natural.

It is made from maple and walnut, with an ebony fret board, dot inlay and 2 V shaped pick-ups. It's about 8.5 lbs. The strap pins are on the back center of the body leading to good weight distribution while having plenty of mobility versus the tip of the wing.

You may read love and hate for the Bill Lawrence 'Boomerang' pickups... both the look and the sound. These are strong output pickups that can give you both smooth and creamy cleans, but with bite using heavy attack and dialing in gain or boost. Reverb sounds magical through them. Inside each, they are actually two pickups angled, one for the three lower strings, one for the high. This creates some interesting articulation. We have read reviewers claim they are muddy, but suspect that was the reviewers amp settings. We're fans, so we also think the Boomerang pickups with the carved curves in the V body and counter pointed head stock make it the most beautiful V ever produced. At the time they were top of the line Gibson instruments and expensive, which may have led to their very short few years of production. A shame in our humble opinion.

One design note, if you like the V shape for seated playing with the open part of the V resting on your thigh, then you'll need a right angle cord plug. The cord jack is on the inside edge of the V midway. With a straight plug you won't be able to rest it on your thigh while seated. Later Vs had the plug on the front near the controls.

The guitar is in excellent condition. Rating condition of vintage guitars is a bit of a dilemma. 40 years+ brings it's own peculiarities. If this were from the 2020s, we would rate it very good. We think the Excellent rating is consistent with the other V2s for sale currently on Reverb. The finish coating is shiny all over with no hazing. There are some nicks and bumps, but nothing breaking the finish, except for the top of the headstock, pictured. Note that their are two dark striations on the shoulders that are natural wood coloration seemingly bookmatched from the same piece of wood.

The case is in fair condition. We believe it's the original case.

We tend to use the 'barn find' approach to maintaining the guitars. We do not try to refresh vintage guitars to look like new. We leave that option up to you, and try to leave the guitars in original state, or as close as possible. So we did not glue down the case Tolex. We did not replace or fix the hinges which likely can be fixed. Interestingly, the red ribbon hinges limits are intact and very strongly attached.

Note that the frets are in great condition with little wear and seemingly little playing time. Flat jumbo frets were standard from the factory. Again, while we would prefer crowned frets, we did not touch them. They are stock.

The guitar was given a setup, cleaning, basic maintenance, and the electronics cleaned by Moe's Guitars in Hawthorne, NJ where we are now having all our maintenance done. It's a great shop and highly regarded in the area.

Shipping must cover the US. If you are around the NYC Metro area, we will be happy to return excess shipping fees. Note that shipping insurance on an instrument of this value is expensive and part of the shipping fee. We reuse boxes that are sturdy... save the planet and all that. We will drive up to 100 miles to meet and hand deliver for a guitar of this value, and bring a battery amp, or you bring yours. Local pickup is welcome.

Serial number has been obscured to prevent spoofing and protect our gear community.

We priced it to sell with list well under the current lowest listed price for these guitars.

Thanks to Dream Guitars for their Youtube Video.

listings.description: rare Gibson guitar: Flying V2 from 1979! Very cool guitar with the special heart-like Pickups. The Pickups are low-output design, so dont expect a heavy metal maschine :).
listings.title: Gibson Flying V2 II 1979 Natural

listings.description: 1980 Gibson Flying V2 in natural finish. This is all original and in very good condition! Five piece walnut/maple body. Ebony fretboard. Has the cool "boomerang" pickups. It does have some natural playwear but overall in good shape. Frets are in good condition. There are 2 little marks by the headstock from a guitar stand/hanger. This is not a repair/break. - see photos. Comes with the original hard shell case.
listings.title: Gibson Flying V2 1980 Natural

listings.description:
100% original and unal example of a classic vintage Gibson! Everything functions perfectly. Original hard-shell case included. Super rare and a real head-turner!

Check out the unique 'Boomerang' pickups by Tim Shaw - one of his first projects when he started at Gibson.

This guitar is destined to be a classic, and will only go up and value! Hit me up with questions or for more photos. Cheers!
listings.title: Gibson Flying V2 1980 - Natural Walnut and Maple - COLLECTOR GRADE!!

listings.description: Beautiful 1981 Gibson Flying V2 II. This guitar is all original and in very good shape for its age. It has a small clearcoat imperfection on the upper bout by the strap button, a little clear coat cracking by the neck joint and just some small wear by the headstock from a hanging stand. Other then that the guitar is free of flaws and any breaks or repairs. The pickups are original and have a very unique sound and the electronics are also all original. The neck is straight and smooth and the frets show almost no wear at all. You will be hard pressed to find a cleaner example of these very rare Flying V II guitars. Will be shipped in its original case. The V2 was one of the first projects taken on by Tim Shaw when he started work at Gibson. The "boomerang" humbucking pickups and the sculpted body are very unique features to the model. Gold hardware with black plastics makes for a lovely aesthetic
listings.title: Gibson Flying V2 Natural Guitar

listings.description: 1979 Gibson V2 is one of 157 built in the first year of production. This example is a one family guitar, and is in very good all original condition. The V2 was one of the first projects taken on by Tim Shaw when he started work at Gibson. The "boomerang" humbucking pickups and the sculpted body are very unique features to the model. Gold hardware with black plastics makes for a lovely aesthetic. Condition wise this guitar is considered "very good". There's a handful of nicks & dings, as well as some buckle rash on the back of the guitar that has been professionally repaired. The repaired area is a bit darker then the rest of the finish. See photos. Guitar is 100% original and is perfectly functioning with no cracks, breaks or other repairs. Included in the sale is the original Gibson hardshell case.
listings.title: Gibson Flying V2 1979 Natural Guitar

listings.description: 1980 Gibson Flying V2 VERY RARE 1980 model features a unique 5 piece sculpted body of walnut and maple. Walnut set neck with walnut/maple laminate and ebony fingerboard. Brass nut. 21 1/2 frets! Two Boomerang pickups. Brass bridge saddles and brass tailpiece. B/W/B/W pickguard. Gold tuning machines. Original hardshell case. Brief synopsis by Zachary R. Fjestad "President Ted McCarty noticed that Gibson‚Äôs solidbody guitars were looking too old and traditional compared to Fender‚Äôs futuristic designs. He assembled a team to design three new instruments and the Flying V was one of the results of their research ‚Äì this guitar was officially unveiled in 1958, along with another futuristic-looking guitar called the Explorer. Very few people caught onto the design and less than 100 Flying Vs were produced during their initial run between 1958 and 1959. However, Gibson never let the project die completely, releasing three variations based on the original design during the late 1960s and into the 1970s. Tim Shaw began working at Gibson in late 1978 and one of his first projects was to design an entirely new Flying V that would be a companion to the new E2 Explorer. The guitar you have is a 1980 Gibson V2, the result of Shaw‚Äôs work in the late ‚Äò70s. This guitar has several unique features that set it apart from earlier Flying V designs. The body is constructed out of a five-piece sandwich design; the contoured edges allow the different layers from the front and the sides to be visible. Brass studs for the bridge, a brass nut, and a brass tailpiece were used to increase sustain (check out the October 2007 Trash or Treasure for more information on brass hardware). Despite all of these design changes, the pickups are what really make this guitar stick out. These V-shaped ‚Äúboomerang‚Äù pickups were designed to produce single coil pickup tone with the noise reduction provided by humbuckers. The design of these pickups is quite complex, and there isn‚Äôt room in this article to offer up all of the details. Note the notch at the end of the fingerboard, needed due to the pickups‚Äô unusual shape. There is no doubt that this Flying V came into existence during one of Gibson‚Äôs bleakest times, but based on uniqueness and originality, the V2 is one of the few bright spots during this era and collectors are beginning to take notice of this unusual V." Instrument is in VERY GOOD CONDITION with a number of dings front and back as well as a few on back of neck. None are serious and do not affect playing or sound.
listings.title: Gibson Flying V2 Natural 1980 Guitar

listings.description: A very nice 1980 Gibson V2 in a natural finish. It has the original case as well
listings.title: Gibson V2 1980 - Natural

listings.description:
The following specs were carefully collected and recorded by a skilled technician. For a more detailed description and questions regarding sound, feel, or cosmetic condition, please call to speak to one of our experts.

Summary

Finish: Finish appears to be original with wear on the arm contour and on the back of the neck.

Body Material: Walnut

Body Details: Five-piece maple/walnut body.

Neck Material: Maple

Neck Profile: C

Neck Thickness (IN): 1st - .83" & 12th - .96"

Fingerboard Radius: 12.00"

Nut Width: 1-11/16"

Scale Length: 24 3/4"

Neck Details: Five-piece mahogany/maple neck with an ebony fingerboard and dot inlays.

Electronics: Original Gibson pickups with a three-position switch, two volume pots, and a master tone pot. The pod codes date to 1979.

Pickup Measurements: Bridge: 12.90kŒ© Neck: 12.86kŒ©

Hardware: Original tuners, brass nut, and tail-piece. The Gotoh bridge is not original.

Weight: 7 lbs 14 oz

Cosmetic Condition: Guitar is in good cosmetic condition with heavy play wear.

Modifications/Repairs: -Non-original Gotoh bridge.

Serial Number: 80510036

Tech Notes: This V2 plays well with low action and optimal neck relief. The frets are low and wide. It has been properly setup and intonated in standard tuning. Serial number dates the guitar to 1980.

Case Details: Original Hardshell Case

We think the Excellent rating is consistent with the other V2s for sale currently on Reverb. The finish coating is shiny all over with no hazing. There are some nicks and bumps, but nothing breaking the finish, except for the top of the headstock, pictured. Note that their are two dark striations on the shoulders that are natural wood coloration seemingly bookmatched from the same piece of wood.

The case is in fair condition. We believe it's the original case.

We tend to use the 'barn find' approach to maintaining the guitars. We do not try to refresh vintage guitars to look like new. We leave that option up to you, and try to leave the guitars in original state, or as close as possible. So we did not glue down the case Tolex. We did not replace or fix the hinges which likely can be fixed. Interestingly, the red ribbon hinges limits are intact and very strongly attached.

Note that the frets are in great condition with little wear and seemingly little playing time. Flat jumbo frets were standard from the factory. Again, while we would prefer crowned frets, we did not touch them. They are stock.

The guitar was given a setup, cleaning, basic maintenance, and the electronics cleaned by Moe's Guitars in Hawthorne, NJ where we are now having all our maintenance done. It's a great shop and highly regarded in the area.

Shipping must cover the US. If you are around the NYC Metro area, we will be happy to return excess shipping fees. Note that shipping insurance on an instrument of this value is expensive and part of the shipping fee. We reuse boxes that are sturdy... save the planet and all that. We will drive up to 100 miles to meet and hand deliver for a guitar of this value, and bring a battery amp, or you bring yours. Local pickup is welcome.

Serial number has been obscured to prevent spoofing and protect our gear community.

We priced it to sell with list well under the current lowest listed price for these guitars.

Thanks to Dream Guitars for their Youtube Video.

description: Beautiful 1981 Gibson Flying V2 II. This guitar is all original and in very good shape for its age. It has a small clearcoat imperfection on the upper bout by the strap button, a little clear coat cracking by the neck joint and just some small wear by the headstock from a hanging stand. Other then that the guitar is free of flaws and any breaks or repairs. The pickups are original and have a very unique sound and the electronics are also all original. The neck is straight and smooth and the frets show almost no wear at all. You will be hard pressed to find a cleaner example of these very rare Flying V II guitars. Will be shipped in its original case. The V2 was one of the first projects taken on by Tim Shaw when he started work at Gibson. The "boomerang" humbucking pickups and the sculpted body are very unique features to the model. Gold hardware with black plastics makes for a lovely aesthetic

title: Gibson Flying V2 1979 Natural Guitar

price_guide.description:
The V2 was a take on the Flying V design produced with a five-piece body and neck made of Maple and Walnut. This guitar featured sculpted edges on the body and a pair of "boomerang" style pickups.¬†

Years of Production:¬†1979 - 1982
price_guide.title: Gibson Flying V2  1980 Natural

description: 1980 Gibson Flying V2 VERY RARE 1980 model features a unique 5 piece sculpted body of walnut and maple. Walnut set neck with walnut/maple laminate and ebony fingerboard. Brass nut. 21 1/2 frets! Two Boomerang pickups. Brass bridge saddles and brass tailpiece. B/W/B/W pickguard. Gold tuning machines. Original hardshell case. Brief synopsis by Zachary R. Fjestad "President Ted McCarty noticed that Gibson‚Äôs solidbody guitars were looking too old and traditional compared to Fender‚Äôs futuristic designs. He assembled a team to design three new instruments and the Flying V was one of the results of their research ‚Äì this guitar was officially unveiled in 1958, along with another futuristic-looking guitar called the Explorer. Very few people caught onto the design and less than 100 Flying Vs were produced during their initial run between 1958 and 1959. However, Gibson never let the project die completely, releasing three variations based on the original design during the late 1960s and into the 1970s. Tim Shaw began working at Gibson in late 1978 and one of his first projects was to design an entirely new Flying V that would be a companion to the new E2 Explorer. The guitar you have is a 1980 Gibson V2, the result of Shaw‚Äôs work in the late ‚Äò70s. This guitar has several unique features that set it apart from earlier Flying V designs. The body is constructed out of a five-piece sandwich design; the contoured edges allow the different layers from the front and the sides to be visible. Brass studs for the bridge, a brass nut, and a brass tailpiece were used to increase sustain (check out the October 2007 Trash or Treasure for more information on brass hardware). Despite all of these design changes, the pickups are what really make this guitar stick out. These V-shaped ‚Äúboomerang‚Äù pickups were designed to produce single coil pickup tone with the noise reduction provided by humbuckers. The design of these pickups is quite complex, and there isn‚Äôt room in this article to offer up all of the details. Note the notch at the end of the fingerboard, needed due to the pickups‚Äô unusual shape. There is no doubt that this Flying V came into existence during one of Gibson‚Äôs bleakest times, but based on uniqueness and originality, the V2 is one of the few bright spots during this era and collectors are beginning to take notice of this unusual V." Instrument is in VERY GOOD CONDITION with a number of dings front and back as well as a few on back of neck. None are serious and do not affect playing or sound.
